title: APT29 (Cozy Bear) Targeting Cloud Infrastructure
description: APT29 has been observed targeting cloud infrastructure of government and technology sectors using sophisticated spear-phishing campaigns and exploiting cloud misconfigurations. The group is leveraging legitimate cloud services for command and control to evade detection.
tactics: Abuse of cloud service provider APIs
recommendations: Implement multi-factor authentication for all cloud accounts
Monitor for unusual API activity patterns
Review and restrict cloud service permissions
Block known IOCs at network perimeter
Conduct phishing awareness training

title: LockBit 3.0 Ransomware Campaign Intensifies
description: LockBit 3.0 ransomware group has intensified operations targeting healthcare, manufacturing, and financial sectors. The group is exploiting Citrix Bleed vulnerability (CVE-2023-4966) as primary initial access vector, followed by rapid lateral movement and deployment of ransomware payloads.
recommendations: Patch all Citrix NetScaler instances immediately
Implement offline immutable backups
Enable EDR on all endpoints
Segment networks to limit lateral movement
Monitor for rapid file modifications
Implement application whitelisting

title: Volt Typhoon Infrastructure Pre-Positioning in US Critical Infrastructure
description: Chinese state-sponsored APT group Volt Typhoon continues to maintain persistent access in U.S. critical infrastructure networks including energy, water, and telecommunications sectors. The group focuses on living-off-the-land techniques and avoiding detection while pre-positioning for potential disruptive operations.
tactics: Exploitation of edge devices and network appliances
Use of built-in OS tools for persistence
Minimal use of malware to avoid detection
recommendations: Audit and patch all edge network devices
Implement robust logging for network devices
Monitor for unusual administrative access
Conduct regular device configuration audits
Implement out-of-band management networks
Deploy threat hunting in OT/ICS environments

title: TA505 Group Deploying FlawedGrace RAT via Malicious Email Campaigns
description: TA505 cybercrime group has launched widespread email campaigns distributing FlawedGrace RAT targeting financial institutions and retail organizations. Campaigns use convincing invoice-themed emails with malicious Excel documents leveraging macro-enabled spreadsheets.
recommendations: Block macros in Office documents from untrusted sources
Implement email filtering and sandboxing
User awareness training on phishing recognition
Deploy endpoint detection with behavioral monitoring
Monitor for unusual Office process spawning

title: Kimsuky APT Targeting South Korean Entities with AppleSeed Backdoor
description: North Korean APT group Kimsuky has been observed targeting South Korean government, defense contractors, and think tanks using spear-phishing emails with malicious HWP documents. The campaign deploys the AppleSeed backdoor for intelligence collection and credential harvesting.
recommendations: Block HWP files at email gateway
Implement application whitelisting
Monitor for unusual browser data access
Deploy deception technologies
Conduct Korean geopolitical threat briefings
